title: How to Create Job Contracts with ChatGPT
description: Protect yourself with professional contracts that take minutes to create.
requirements: Basic understanding of what you want to cover

steps.title: Decide when you need contracts
steps.description: Not every job needs a formal contract.
substeps: Good rule: Any job over $500 should have one
Always for: Large projects, new customers, complex scopes
Also good for: Anything where scope creep could happen
steps.tip: A signed contract prevents 'I thought that was included' arguments.

steps.title: Ask ChatGPT to draft your contract
substeps: Go to chat.openai.com

Type: 'Create a simple job contract for a [your trade] business. Include: scope of work, price, payment terms, timeline, what's included, what's excluded, and cancellation policy. Make it professional but easy to understand.'
Review what it creates

steps.title: Customize the key sections
substeps: Scope of work: Exactly what you will (and won't) do
Price and payment: Total, deposit, when final payment is due
Timeline: Start date, expected completion
Exclusions: What's NOT included (important!)
Change orders: How you handle additional work requests
steps.tip: Be specific in scope. 'Paint living room' vs 'Paint living room walls, not ceiling or trim.'

steps.title: Add your business info
substeps: Your business name and contact info
License number (if required in your state)
Customer name and address
Signature lines for both parties
Date field

steps.title: Create a fillable template
steps.description: Set it up for easy reuse.
substeps: Use Google Docs: File → Make a copy for each job
Or use a free e-signature tool like Signaturely or DocuSign (free tier)
Replace job-specific details with [brackets] as placeholders
Save as 'Contract Template - [Your Business]'

steps.title: Get it signed
steps.description: A contract isn't valid until both parties sign.
substeps: Send the contract before starting work
Use e-signature (Signaturely, DocuSign free) or get a physical signature
Collect deposit after they sign
Save a copy of every signed contract

successMessage: You now have a professional contract template! Use it for every significant job.
proTips: Ask a local lawyer to review your template once — it's worth the $100-200
Always include what's NOT included — this prevents most disputes
Change orders should require written approval before you do additional work
